about:
Let's connect cultural and technological knowledge to empower community with the right tools to take care of one another.

Career recap:
- Professional juggler for audiences of >10,000 since the age of 10
- Motivational keynote speaker at a Fortune 500 company by age 18
- Delivered solar power to the Amazon Jungle
- Commanded 30 Marine Corps midshipmen in Camp Pendleton
- Drove a nuclear submarine
- Managed a team of 70 people at a startup with a senior researcher from OpenAI
- Delivered medical supplies to the front line of Ukraine used to save multiple lives
- Organizer of a conference with Vitalik Buterin, Balaji Srinivasan, Robin Hanson as speakers
- Managed a >1M grant program for the Zuzalu ecosystem

Now building normie.tech, the checkout page that pays you in stablecoins. 

Interests: Crowdfunding, AI, Indigenous Rights, Mutualism, Network Societies, Juggling, Fire-eating

experience.description: Created a credit card checkout page that forwards customer payments as stablecoins to your wallet or smart contract.Profitable by month 4.

Led a team of 5 building a blockchain based crowdfunded prize platform. Impact of our prizes: multiple lives saved, kids shelter funded, >10 open source projects winning including an app with >10,000 downloads

experience.location: San Francisco, California, United States · On-site
experience.description: Dropped out of UC Berkeley and the Marines when I couldn't take care of my loved ones in Ecuador and afford rent. With no traditional credentials or offers, befriended a senior researcher at OpenAI who hired me when he launched his startup. Built and managed a team of 70 people for our data labeling operations. Developed systems from scratch for recruiting, onboarding, retention and pay, and quality control then trained a team of managers to take it over. Organized events, ran cold outreach, and joined sales calls.

Professional juggler and motivational speaker. Learned to run my business including sending invoices, cold outreach, and coordinating hiring other performers. Achieved goal of earning $6,000 during the first summer of starting and used the funds to backpack through two dozen countries. Street performed around the world. Joined a fire juggling troupe. MC for shows with the West African Slyboots Circus. Scaled up from small gigs at parties to making $1500/hr as a motivational speaker and presenting for Fortune 500 companies.

Won the selective NROTC Marine Corps full ride scholarship. Commanded a platoon of 30 Midshipman at Camp Pendleton. Drove an SSGN submarine with nuclear weapons on board. Mentored by enlisted soldiers and officers with wartime experience in how to operate a team united in an urgent objective while under pressure
